content.question: The point of view expressed in the excerpt is that

choices.label: as a Virginian, he opposes the expansion of colonial settlements into western lands where White settlers could encounter violent opposition from America Indians
as a British official, he believes that White Virginians must learn to protect themselves if they are to expand their settlements
as a reformer, he values the lives of White Virginians equally with those of allied American Indians
as Governor, he feels a responsibility to protect White frontier settlers from violent encounters with American Indians

content.answer: as Governor, he feels a responsibility to protect White frontier settlers from violent encounters with American Indians

topic.text: 2.5: Interactions Between American Indians and Europeans
